column5: Hey, I was talking to a coworker they were looking for a gift idea for her husband so I suggested her to buy him a flight lesson, where he can go fly aplane for an hour or whatever it is. She loved the idea, but I wouldn't be able to offer her a suggestion as to where to go. Do you know a place that would be good that offer something like this?

When I turned 40, my wife hired a pilot and plane out of Lake St. John near Orillia to take me for a flight over Lake Dalrymple. It was a float plane and he insisted that She come with us! We actually went a lot further and flew over several lakes. He asked if I wanted to to land on any because he was an Instructor and was certified on a large number of lakes to land. I told him I could go for a "boat ride" any day and said I wanted to stay up for as long as possible! It was a good time!
I will be going on a float plane for the first time in September and can`t wait!!!
I'll second Brampton Flying Club. They offer cheap Intro flights and it's where I got license many years ago.
If your in the London Area I recommend Cross Wind aviation.
Depends where you live. Call any flying club - most offer cheap introductory flights, with the hope people will become hooked and sign up for flying lessons.
Call Buttonville airport and they can direct you. HH
Thanks, I gave her the contact info for the place in brampton.
Edenvale Flying Club on Hwy 26 at the old military base just East of Stayner.
